info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:29PM MDT until August 24 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CUSTER AND NORTH CENTRAL FALL RIVER COUNTIES... At 228 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles north of Cottonwood Springs Dam, or 6 miles northwest of Hot Springs, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 210 PM...ping pong ball sized hail was reported 1 mile northeast of Argyle. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs, Cold Brook Reservoir, Cottonwood Springs Dam and southwestern Wind Cave National Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
